channel.title: tidyverse on cod3x & err@ta
channel.description: Recent content in tidyverse on cod3x & err@ta

item.title: World War II Flying Aces - Casualties by country (part 3)
item.description: @mjfrigaard here to This is part 3 of a series looking at World War II flying aces. In part 1, I showed how to download data from a Wikipedia (html) table. Then in part 2, I showed some wrangling techniques with dplyr and janitor, and some exploratory data analysis with inspectdf. We discovered that Germany had the highest average number of aerial victories. In this post we will look at the casualties and survivability of flying aces in WW2.

item.title: World War II Flying Aces - Exploratory data analysis packages/techniques (part 2)
item.description: These data come from the Wikipedia page here, and I went over downloading these data in my previous post. The WW2 fighter pilot data In this post, Iâ€™ll be covering some data wrangling and manipulation with the tidyverse. I will also be using the janitor, inspectdf, and ggplot2 packages. Load the packages library(tidyverse) library(inspectdf) library(janitor) Download data The data from the previous post have been stored in a Github repo here.
